document_type: ISO 27001 Security Requirements - Annex A Control
applies_to_note: All gambling operators subject to RTS Chapter 4 - Security Requirements

control.control_title: Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment
control.control_purpose: To ensure information security responsibilities remain valid and are enforced after personnel termination or role change
control.control_objective: Define, communicate, and enforce information security responsibilities that persist after termination or change of employment

iso_27001_definition.official_text: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment should be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.
key_requirements: Applied to third parties and suppliers

control_purpose_detail.purpose: Preventive control protecting organization information and assets after personnel depart or change roles
control_purpose_detail.key_outcome: Personnel and departing employees understand and comply with ongoing security obligations

prerequisites.description: Before implementing termination responsibilities control, foundational elements must be in place

required_prerequisites.rationale: Policy must be communicated as basis for ongoing responsibilities
required_prerequisites.reference: ISO 27001 A 5.1 - Policies for information security

required_prerequisites.rationale: Termination responsibilities integrated into HR processes

required_prerequisites.description: Access to legal counsel and HR professionals
required_prerequisites.rationale: Contract clauses must be legally valid and enforceable

required_prerequisites.description: Established process for new hire onboarding
required_prerequisites.rationale: Contracts signed and communicated during onboarding

termination_responsibilities_overview.definition: Information security obligations that remain binding on individuals after they leave organization or change employment role
common_responsibilities: Not disclose confidential information to unauthorized parties
Not use confidential information for personal benefit
Not retain copies of confidential information
Comply with non-compete agreements if applicable
Comply with non-solicitation agreements if applicable

implementation_requirements.description: Clearly identify and document what information security responsibilities continue after employment ends

responsibilities_to_define: Asset return requirements - what must be returned
Information destruction - what must be destroyed
Access removal - when and how access is revoked
Cooperation obligations - willingness to cooperate on investigations
Liability for breaches - potential consequences of violations
Intellectual property - ownership of work product
factors_by_role: Technical roles with system access - stricter requirements

implementation_requirements.description: Incorporate defined responsibilities into employment contracts

legal_requirements: Drafted by or reviewed by legal counsel

implementation_requirements.description: Obtain professional advice on contract validity and enforceability

hr_collaboration: HR maintains records of signed contracts
HR manages transitions and role changes
details.best_practice: Maintain ongoing relationship with legal counsel for annual review and updates

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure new personnel understand post-employment obligations

onboarding_process: Present employment contract to new hire
Review asset ownership and return requirements
Have employee sign and date contract
Retain signed copy in personnel file

implementation_requirements.description: Reinforce obligations when employee changes roles within organization

role_change_process: Discuss new role and access requirements
Review confidentiality obligations in new role
Update contract or sign acknowledgment if needed
Provide training on new role responsibilities
affected_scenarios: Change to role with greater access
Move to role with compliance responsibilities

implementation_requirements.description: Execute formal offboarding process protecting organization security

offboarding_steps: Notify HR, IT, and security of termination
Revoke system access immediately or at end of day
Review access logs for suspicious activity
Change shared passwords and encryption keys
Provide written summary of ongoing obligations
timing: Access revocation - immediate or end of business day
Exit interview - on last day or before

implementation_requirements.description: Ensure orderly handover of duties to prevent gaps

handover_process: Identify roles and responsibilities of departing person
Verify successor is ready before departure

implementation_requirements.requirement: Apply to Third Parties and Suppliers
implementation_requirements.description: Extend obligations to contractors, consultants, and vendors
Take action to ensure continuing compliance with obligations

specific_actions: Review for unauthorized use of information

implementation_requirements.description: Create documented policy addressing termination and change of employment

policy_elements: Objectives - what policy is trying to achieve

implementation_requirements.description: Keep records of contracts and termination activities

documents_to_maintain: Signed employment contracts for all employees
retention: Retain records for period after termination

steps.detail: Document policy on responsibilities after termination or role change
Define specific security obligations continuing after employment
Have attorney review and draft employment contract clauses
Collaborate with HR on implementation and enforcement
Develop standardized contract with security responsibilities
Document process for signing contracts and communicating responsibilities
Document termination process with security controls
Begin using contract template with all new employees
Have existing employees sign updated contracts (if not already signed)
Ensure HR and managers understand and follow procedures

compliance_checklist.description: Steps to comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 6.5

checklist.item: Have contracts reviewed by legal counsel
Implement contracts with all new employees
Document and communicate responsibilities to employees
Train HR and management on procedures
Maintain signed contracts in personnel files

common_mistakes.description: Top 3 mistakes organizations make with termination responsibilities

mistakes.description: Personnel lack written employment contracts with security clauses
root_cause: Belief that 'everyone knows and trusts each other'
Misconception that written contracts damage relationships
mistakes.impact: No legal basis for enforcing security obligations, cannot pursue legal action for breaches, non-compliance with ISO 27001
prevention: Implement employment contracts as standard practice
Have legal counsel draft or review contracts
Ensure all parties understand legal value
mistakes.requirement: Employment contracts with security obligations are mandatory for compliance

mistakes.mistake: HR team not aware of or following procedures
mistakes.description: HR not executing onboarding/offboarding procedures correctly
root_cause: No accountability or audit of HR activities
mistakes.impact: Some employees lack signed contracts, access not revoked promptly, assets not returned, no evidence of communication
prevention: Train all HR staff on procedures
mistakes.best_practice: Pre-audit check that all HR team members understand and execute procedures correctly

mistakes.mistake: Document version control and maintenance issues
mistakes.description: Contract templates or policies not current or properly maintained
mistakes.impact: Contracts may not reflect current legal requirements, non-enforceable clauses, inconsistent application
prevention: Review contracts annually with legal counsel
Update for legal or regulatory changes
Remove draft comments from final versions

audit_requirements.description: What auditors will check during ISO 27001 A 6.5 audit

audit_areas.description: Verify employment contracts include security responsibilities
checks: Contract template exists and is documented
Template covers asset ownership and return
Contract language is clear and enforceable
Contracts are retained in personnel files
audit_areas.best_practice: Sample review of active contracts against template

audit_areas.description: Verify contracts have been reviewed for legal enforceability
checks: Clauses are enforceable under applicable law
Clauses are reasonable and not overly broad

audit_areas.description: Verify post-employment responsibilities are clearly defined
Verify personnel aware of post-employment responsibilities
checks: Employees provided with signed contract copy

audit_areas.description: Verify contracts signed and communicated during onboarding
Verify termination process includes responsibility communication
checks: Written summary provided to departing employee

audit_areas.description: Verify contractors and third parties have similar obligations

ukgc_application.critical_systems_context: For gambling operators, personnel with access to RNG systems, customer funds, or regulatory information must remain bound by security obligations after employment

responsibility_requirements: Personnel with RNG access must maintain confidentiality of systems and methodologies
Non-disclosure of game algorithms or RNG implementation details
Ongoing obligation to not disclose methodologies to competitors
Indefinite confidentiality of customer personal data
Obligation not to use customer data for personal benefit
Compliance with data protection regulations indefinitely
Ongoing confidentiality of compliance monitoring results
Obligation to report violations to appropriate authorities
Non-compete obligations preventing direct competitor work
Intellectual property ownership of work product

ukgc_application.compliance_requirement: Operators must have enforceable contracts with all personnel defining ongoing information security responsibilities after employment termination or role change

compliance_notes.overall_purpose: Protect organization information and assets by ensuring security obligations continue and are enforceable after personnel depart or change roles
compliance_notes.enforcement_priority: High - personnel departures pose significant risk if obligations not properly defined and enforced
key_principles: Third parties and suppliers subject to same obligations

to_pass_the_audit.description: To comply with ISO 27001 Annex A 6.5 Responsibilities After Termination or Change of Employment, implement

requirements.detail: Document policy on post-employment security responsibilities
List what security obligations continue after employment
Create template including security responsibility clauses
Have attorney review and approve contract language
Document termination process with security controls
Contractors and suppliers have similar obligations

contract_best_practices: Have employment contracts reviewed by qualified employment law attorney

process_best_practices: Implement contracts with all new employees immediately
Train HR team on proper execution
Document contract signing date in personnel file
Retain signed original in personnel file

Return of all system documentation and tools
